Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Design and establish the WHEMCOM Joint Intelligence Fusion Cell (JIFC-HEM).
Land: Design manning, SOPs, and HUMINT integration.
Sea: Define maritime intel inputs and liaison roles.
Air: Define air ISR inputs and ATO links.
Cyber: Design secure intel networks and cross-domain solutions.
Space: Plan space ISR feeds and archival policies.
Branch_Notes: If design is not approved on time, fusion operations (1.1.1b) slip and downstream ISR/intel-dependent OAIs are delayed.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Operate and refine JIFC-HEM for sustained multinational intelligence fusion.
Land: Run daily land-focused fusion boards and HUMINT review.
Sea: Continuously ingest maritime tracks and boarding reports.
Air: Fuse air tracks and ISR into the shared picture.
Cyber: Maintain and secure intel networks and tools.
Space: Exploit space imagery and feeds for regional awareness.
Branch_Notes: If key partners do not fill seats or share data (DP2), branch to a reduced-national fusion model and heavier reliance on unilateral ISR.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Plan bilateral and multilateral intelligence planning workshops.
Land: Identify land intel gaps and priority partners.
Sea: Select maritime focus areas and partner navies/coast guards.
Air: Identify airspace and ISR coordination requirements.
Cyber: Define cyber intel exchange mechanisms.
Space: Identify space-derived products for sharing.
Decisive_Point_1_Label: Partner Set Locked for Initial Round
Branch_Notes: If partners decline participation, scale to smaller group and adjust expectations for shared threat picture under 1.1.2b.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Conduct intel planning workshops to build a shared regional threat picture.
Land: Co-develop regional land threat picture and priorities.
Sea: Co-develop maritime threat models and smuggling routes.
Air: Align air threat picture and air defense/ISR priorities.
Cyber: Agree cyber intel sharing protocols and formats.
Space: Train partners on space products and interpretation.
Decisive_Point_1_Label: Shared Threat Picture Adopted by Core Partners
Branch_Notes: If workshops reveal deep political/legal divergence, branch to tiered intel-sharing model (inner circle vs outer circle).

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Design secure communication and data-sharing architecture for partners.
Land: Map land HQs and intel nodes needing secure access.
Sea: Define maritime nodes (ships, ops centers, JIATF-S) to connect.
Air: Define air C2 centers and ISR nodes needing connectivity.
Cyber: Select crypto standards, identity, and access solutions.
Space: Define SATCOM and space ISR bandwidth needs.
Branch_Notes: If architecture is judged too complex/expensive, branch to phased rollout or reduced partner set for 1.1.3b.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Field and sustain secure comms and data-sharing platforms among partners.
Land: Install secure nodes at land HQs and fusion centers.
Sea: Upgrade shipboard/naval ops center datalinks.
Air: Integrate air ops centers into common track picture.
Cyber: Operate and defend encrypted networks and services.
Space: Maintain SATCOM and space links for continuous sharing.
Branch_Notes: If key partners refuse deployment or restrict use, branch to mixed-secure/legacy comms model and accept slower intel sharing.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Plan hemispheric JAG and MoD legal conference.
Land: Identify land, SOF, and border law issues.
Sea: Identify maritime interdiction and hot pursuit gaps.
Air: Identify air policing, intercept, and overflight issues.
Cyber: Identify cyber crime, data sharing, and evidence standards.
Space: Identify legal use of space ISR and imagery.
Branch_Notes: If major partners decline attendance, branch to sub-regional or bilateral legal engagements instead of a single hemispheric event.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Conduct conference and document legal frameworks and gaps.
Land: Clarify land and SOF legal boundaries and constraints.
Sea: Clarify maritime interdiction and hot pursuit rules.
Air: Clarify air intercept and cross-border air operations.
Cyber: Summarize cyber legal regimes and evidentiary requirements.
Space: Agree norms for sharing space-based ISR.
Branch_Notes: If consensus is not reached on authorities (esp. lethal maritime), branch to differentiated legal tracks and limit ambitions in 1.1.5b.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Draft standardized SOFAs and intel-sharing agreements.
Land: Draft SOFA language for land forces and trainers.
Sea: Draft VBSS and boarding provisions for maritime ops.
Air: Draft air basing, refuel, and transit rights clauses.
Cyber: Draft cross-border digital pursuit and cyber clauses.
Space: Draft provisions for space-based monitoring and sharing.
Branch_Notes: If drafts are politically unacceptable to multiple partners, branch to modular templates (core + optional clauses).

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Negotiate and implement SOFAs and intel-sharing agreements with key regional partners.
Land: Secure land SOFAs and status protections with key partners.
Sea: Secure VBSS/joint interdiction agreements with navies/coast guards.
Air: Secure air basing and transit rights agreements.
Cyber: Implement digital evidence and cyber-sharing arrangements.
Space: Implement norms for space ISR data access and sharing.
Branch_Notes: If partners reject lethal or regime-change-adjacent provisions at DP1/DP2, branch to a more limited authorities architecture and adjust operational ambition in OBJ 2 and 3.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Plan and assign LNO support to OAS/IADB initiatives.
Land: Identify land-focused initiatives needing planners.
Sea: Identify maritime security efforts needing naval planners.
Air: Identify air safety/interoperability forums needing support.
Cyber: Identify cyber coordination or CERT initiatives.
Space: Identify space/sensor support for disaster/security work.
Branch_Notes: Low-risk enabling activity; no major branching decisions expected beyond normal prioritization of which initiatives to support first.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Deploy LNOs and integrate WHEMCOM support to OAS/IADB.
Land: Embed planners in OAS/IADB land security projects.
Sea: Support maritime doctrine and coordination efforts.
Air: Support air interoperability and safety planning.
Cyber: Link regional CERTs via OAS/IADB.
Space: Provide space imagery/data for planning.
Decisive_Point_1_Label: OAS/IADB Seen as Relevant Security Forum
Branch_Notes: If OAS/IADB remain politically paralyzed, branch to using smaller coalitions and ad hoc groupings as primary legitimacy forums.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Design WHEMCOM-led IO campaign supporting coalition narrative.
Land: Map land target audiences and themes.
Sea: Frame maritime presence and interdiction as cooperative.
Air: Frame airlift/ISR missions as transparent and humanitarian.
Cyber: Design cyber/social campaigns to counter disinformation.
Space: Plan use of unclassified space imagery in messaging.
Branch_Notes: If DOS/partners reject themes as too aggressive, branch to a softer, resilience/resilience-based IO posture.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Execute IO campaign and adapt to adversary narratives.
Land: Use land engagements and KLEs to reinforce IO.
Sea: Publicize joint maritime patrols and interdictions.
Air: Showcase airlift/ISR in HA/DR and DSCA missions.
Cyber: Continuously counter adversary narratives online.
Space: Publish space imagery exposing malign activities.
Branch_Notes: If IO backfires domestically or with partners, branch to narrower, less visible messaging and shift emphasis to quiet diplomacy.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Plan persistent SFA-B missions (C-TCO, border, cyber, C-UAS).
Land: Identify partner land units for priority advising.
Sea: Identify navies/coast guards for interdiction training.
Air: Identify air forces needing ISR and C-UAS support.
Cyber: Identify partner cyber institutions needing training.
Space: Identify use of commercial/space ISR in training.
Branch_Notes: If high-risk partners present HR/legitimacy issues, branch to tiered SFA prioritizing countries with better governance.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Execute SFA-B capacity-building missions with partners.
Land: Advise/train ground units on C-TCO and borders.
Sea: Train maritime units in interdiction and small-boat ops.
Air: Train air units on ISR integration and C-UAS.
Cyber: Conduct cyber training and joint exercises.
Space: Coach partners on tasking commercial/space ISR.
Branch_Notes: If partner units are captured by corrupt/political interests, branch to discontinuation or redirection of SFA to alternative institutions.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Plan expansion of IMET and State Partnership Program.
Land: Identify land institutions for IMET seats.
Sea: Identify maritime academies/navies for exchanges.
Air: Identify air academies/units for exchanges.
Cyber: Identify cyber schools and CERTs for partnerships.
Space: Identify space/ISR education opportunities.
Branch_Notes: If budget or political constraints block expansion, branch to focusing scarce slots on fence-sitter nations most at risk of PRC/RUS influence.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Execute expanded IMET and SPP engagements.
Land: Send land officers/NCOs to U.S. PME.
Sea: Host naval/coast guard officers for maritime PME.
Air: Host partner air officers for aviation training.
Cyber: Create cyber range exchanges and CERT drills.
Space: Educate partners on space ISR/SDA basics.
Decisive_Point_1_Label: New Cohort in Key Leadership Positions
Branch_Notes: If key alumni are co-opted by authoritarian regimes, branch to stricter vetting and possible program suspension in those states.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Plan multinational exercise Hemisphere Shield.
Land: Design land scenarios for border security/HA/DR.
Sea: Design maritime interdiction and MIO vignettes.
Air: Design air C2/ISR/DSCA support scenarios.
Cyber: Plan cyber defense and incident response injects.
Space: Plan space-enabled targeting and COP play.
Branch_Notes: If partners balk at politically sensitive vignettes (e.g., near Venezuela), branch to scenario adjustments before 1.1.10b.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
OAI_Description: Execute Hemisphere Shield and capture lessons.
Land: Rehearse land border security and HA/DR.
Sea: Conduct combined maritime interdiction/MIO events.
Air: Conduct air integration and DSCA airlift scenarios.
Cyber: Run cyber incident response drills.
Space: Employ space-enabled targeting and shared COP.
Branch_Notes: If exercise exposes severe gaps or political blowback, branch to focused, smaller-scale bilateral training instead of large multilateral events.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Maintain & Protect the Multinational Homeland Defense
OAI_Description: Plan integration of Canadian and Mexican partners into JTF-HD.
Land: Define land HD roles for partners.
Sea: Define maritime contributions and coastal sensor coverage.
Air: Define air defense and NORAD integration points.
Cyber: Define HD-relevant cyber defense roles.
Space: Define space early warning integration with partners.
Branch_Notes: If Mexico or Canada reject deeper HD role, branch to asymmetric integration (e.g., stronger NORAD vs lighter Mexican engagement).

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Maintain & Protect the Multinational Homeland Defense
OAI_Description: Execute and rehearse multinational homeland defense plans.
Land: Conduct land HD CPXs/FTXs with partners.
Sea: Coordinate maritime HD patrols and sensors.
Air: Coordinate air defense and alert missions.
Cyber: Operate shared HD-relevant cyber monitoring.
Space: Integrate space-based early warning feeds.
Branch_Notes: If partners impose new caveats after rehearsals, branch to reduced HD reliance and more unilateral U.S. capabilities.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Maintain & Protect the Multinational Homeland Defense
OAI_Description: Plan early-warning ISR investments and siting.
Land: Select land sites for supporting infrastructure.
Sea: Select maritime radar and sensor locations.
Air: Select air OTH radar and aerostat sites.
Cyber: Plan secure ISR control and data networks.
Space: Plan integration with space-based missile warning.
Branch_Notes: If environmental/political concerns block key sites, branch to alternative siting or heavier space-based sensing reliance.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Maintain & Protect the Multinational Homeland Defense
OAI_Description: Deploy and operate shared early-warning ISR systems.
Land: Build land infrastructure and protection.
Sea: Deploy maritime warning radars and feeds.
Air: Operate air warning radars and cueing systems.
Cyber: Maintain secure ISR networks.
Space: Fuse space-based missile warning into picture.
Branch_Notes: If budget cuts or technology delays occur, branch to staggered deployment and prioritized threat axes.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Preserve Maritime Interdiction & Border Security Capacity
OAI_Description: Plan persistent joint/combined maritime interdiction posture.
Land: Identify land staging areas and ports.
Sea: Identify maritime patrol patterns and chokepoints.
Air: Identify MPA and ISR support requirements.
Cyber: Identify cyber protections for maritime C2.
Space: Identify space MDA products to cue interdiction.
Branch_Notes: If partners reject high-risk areas or ROE, branch to more conservative posture and adjust expectations for OBJ 2 effects.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Preserve Maritime Interdiction & Border Security Capacity
OAI_Description: Conduct persistent maritime interdiction operations.
Land: Use land staging and law-enforcement support.
Sea: Maintain USCG/USN/partner patrols.
Air: Provide MPA/ISR coverage.
Cyber: Defend maritime C2 networks from cyber attack.
Space: Use space AIS/SAR to locate suspect vessels.
Branch_Notes: If legal objections (e.g., boat strikes) increase, branch to non-lethal focus and shift some effort to financial/cyber pressure.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Preserve Maritime Interdiction & Border Security Capacity
OAI_Description: Plan ISR and planning support for DHS/CBP border ops.
Land: Map land crossing points and corridors.
Sea: Map maritime approaches feeding land pressure.
Air: Identify air ISR coverage gaps.
Cyber: Identify cyber intel needs on TCO infrastructure.
Space: Identify space imagery requirements for border monitoring.
Branch_Notes: If DHS/CBP have divergent priorities, branch to narrower WHEMCOM support on high-risk corridors only.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Preserve Maritime Interdiction & Border Security Capacity
OAI_Description: Provide ongoing ISR and planning support to border ops.
Land: Provide ground-based ISR and planning cells.
Sea: Support coastal interdiction with CBP/navies.
Air: Provide air tracks and ISR to border task forces.
Cyber: Share TCO cyber intel with DHS/CBP SOCs.
Space: Use space imagery for route/camp detection.
Branch_Notes: If domestic political concerns about militarization grow, branch to lower-visibility, analytic-only support.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Ensure DSCA Responsiveness During Venezuela-Driven Instability
OAI_Description: Plan pre-positioning of HA/DR stocks in key partners.
Land: Identify land depots and secure storage.
Sea: Identify maritime ports for HA/DR throughput.
Air: Identify airfields suitable as hubs.
Cyber: Plan resilient DSCA comms.
Space: Identify space imagery needs for rapid assessment.
Branch_Notes: If partners fear politicization of HA/DR stocks, branch to U.S.-only prepositioning on U.S.-controlled sites.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Ensure DSCA Responsiveness During Venezuela-Driven Instability
OAI_Description: Pre-position and maintain HA/DR stocks with partners.
Land: Establish land depots and control.
Sea: Route HA/DR via selected ports and sealift.
Air: Use airlift for critical HA/DR flows.
Cyber: Maintain DSCA comms/IT.
Space: Use space imagery to refine routing and staging.
Branch_Notes: If a major HA/DR event reveals corruption/misdirection, branch to tighter controls or centralized U.S. custody of stocks.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Ensure DSCA Responsiveness During Venezuela-Driven Instability
OAI_Description: Plan DSCA/FDR exercises with interagency and partners.
Land: Define land-based DSCA scenarios.
Sea: Define maritime HA/DR support vignettes.
Air: Define airlift/medevac scenarios.
Cyber: Define cyber continuity arrangements.
Space: Define space product integration for DSCA.
Branch_Notes: If interagency balks at military-heavy scenarios, branch to more civilian-led DSCA constructs.

Objective_Title: Strengthen & Protect Western Hemisphere Partnership Network
IMO_Title: Ensure DSCA Responsiveness During Venezuela-Driven Instability
OAI_Description: Execute DSCA/FDR exercises and refine plans.
Land: Conduct land DSCA drills with FEMA/USAID/partners.
Sea: Exercise port & maritime HA/DR.
Air: Exercise air evacuation/airlift.
Cyber: Test DSCA IT/cyber resilience.
Space: Use space-derived products in DSCA planning.
Branch_Notes: If DSCA execution reveals severe civil-military frictions, branch to reduced operational visibility and more support-to-civil-power framing.
